description.narrative: TDLG project addresses the institutional challenges in local governance structures, emphasizing planning at township level.

participating-org.narrative: SDC-Swiss Agency For Development and Co

activity-description.narrative: Facilitate Township planning process; Support preparing Township Plans; Provide procurement training; Arrange open budget training for Public; provide womens leadership training in 10 supported of Mon State

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.1.1 Number of supported townships which meet set criteria to perform participatory planning effectively (functionality index) 1.2.1 Percentage of grant/project executed within fiscal year 1.2.2 Percentage of projects (a) starting implementation and (b) completed physical and financial progress in line with Grant Manual and Procurement Guidelines
1.2.3 Number of townships where projects meet minimum benchmarks as per Procurement Guidelines 1.3.1 Number of supported townships in which at least five social accountability mechanisms are used 2.1.1 Number of women benefitted (trained) from women empowerment measures enable to advocate for women concerns; 2.2.1 Percentage of W/VTAs that hold and document at least three community consultations on community priorities involving both men and women during the planning process
2.3.1 Percentage of CSO engaged in supported Townships reporting having improved engagement with Township Administrations 3.1.1 Percentage of grant that funds projects located in EAO areas 3.2.1 Number of supported Townships with EAO areas showing improved engagement between EAOs and TA on service delivery
4.1.1 Number of case studies, policy documents and knowledge products produced based on lesson learned from township planning process, PFM, testing of social accountability, gender actions and engaging CSO in documenting changes at community. 4.1.2 Number of policy dialogues, workshops and learning events that informed policy discussion in relation to scale up and national replication of township planning model

comment.narrative: 1.1 No structured popular participation and citizen consultation during township planning process 1.2 No grants executed 1.3 No procurement guidelines at township level 1.4 No social accountability mechanisms in place 2.1 No systematic public participation of women in the planning process 2.2 Participatory planning process stipulated in Grant Manual not followed 2.3 No systematic engagement of CSO in planning process 3.1 No project intervention: EAOs not engaged with Township Administrations in planning process 3.2 No project intervention: EAOs not engaged with Township Administrations in planning process 4. No product

Revised ME framework as of 28th of February 2019 1.1 Out of 15 townships at least 12 townships meet level 3 across 4 functions 1.2.1 95% of full grant amount allocated during planning cycle FY 2017/2018 has been liquidated through implementation of planned projects 1.2.2 At least 70 % of selected projects from fiscal year 2018-2019 completed physical progress in line with standards as per Grant Manual and Procurement Guidelines 1.2.3. Out of 15 at least 10 supported townships partially comply with set criteria 1.3.1 Out of 15 at least 10 supported townships use at least five social accountability mechanisms are used effectively 2.1.1 At least 300 women in all 15 supported townships benefitted from women empowerment measures within the framework of the project 2.2.1 At least 300 W/VTA in all 15 supported townships hold at least 3 community consultations involving both men and women during the planning process 2.3.1 80% of supported CSO in all supported townships reach level 3 3.1.1 No control over the target since the decisions are taken in a consultative and participatory manner at each planning cycle and therefore selected projects will be defined after prioritization with all key stakeholders. 3.2.1. 75% of supported townships with EAO areas reach Level 2 4.1.1. 6 products 4.1.2: 7

Some results will be available bi-annually, hence no reporting under all results: 1.1.1 15 annual township plans developed in compliance with the Grant manual meeting minimum conditions (MCs) 1.2.1 Fiscal Year 2018/19, 99.5% of township grants allocated to the 5 townships in Bago Region have been executed as of 30th of June 2019; 10 townships in Mon State executed 100% of the township development grant in the first quarter of 2019 1.2.2 The projects FY 2018/19 in Mon State and Bago Region have been completed to a degree of 90% each. 1.2.3 No data available 1.3.1 All 5 social accountability mechanisms were used (where applicable) in the Mon and Bago 15 supported townships 2.1.1 In Mon State, 121 women benefitted from women empowerment measures (women caucus groups, TOT of women leadership training, gender awareness raising workshop) 2.2.1 To be reported as part of the next planning cycle starting in February 2020. 2.3.1 82.5% interviewed CSOs engaged constructively with administration department. 3.1.1 As part of the grant cycle for FY 2019/20, a total of 3 projects (out of 9 projects in supported townships where there are EAO areas) were selected in areas of mixed control. 44.27% of the total grant allocated to the 6 townships where there are EAO areas, are implemented directly in mixed-controlled areas of KNU and NMSP. Funding-wise, this represents 100% of the grant allocation to Bilin township, 28% of the grant allocation to Thaton township and 100% of the grant allocation to Ye in Mon State for FY 2019/20. 3.2.1: Nil – survey on the engagement between Township administrations and EAO was not conducted in 2019. 4.1.1: 6 knowledge products 4.1.2: 6 learning events

1.1.2 ;Out of 15 townships at least 12 townships meet level 4 across 4 function 1.2.1; 95% of full grant amount allocated during planning cycle FY 2018/2019 has been liquidated through implementation of planned projects 1.2.2 ; At least 90% of selected projects from fiscal year 2018-2019 completed physical progress in line with standards as per Grant Manual and Procurement Guidelines 1.2.3; Out of 15 at least 10 supported townships fully comply with set criteria 1.3.1: 15 supported townships use at least five and more social accountability mechanisms are used effectively 2.1.1: at least 500 women in all 15 supported townships benefitted from women empowerment measures within the framework of the project 2.2.1: at least 500 W/VTA in all 15 supported townships hold at least 3 community consultations involving both men and women during the planning process 2.3.1: 80% of supported CSO in all supported townships reach level 4 3.1.1: No control over the target since the decisions are taken in a consultative and participatory manner at each planning cycle and therefore selected projects will be defined after prioritization with all key stakeholders. 3.2.1: 75% of supported townships with EAO areas reach Level 4 4.1.1: At least 15 products 4.1.2: 9(cumulative) products

Updated December 21, 2020 1.1.2; Out of 15 townships 13 meet level 4 across 4 function. Target achieved. 1.2.1; 100% of full grant amount allocated during planning cycle FY 2018/2019 has been liquidated through implementation of planned projects . Target achieved. 1.2.2 ; 100% of selected projects from fiscal year 2018-2019 completed physical progress in line with standards as per Grant Manual and Procurement Guidelines. Target achieved. 1.2.3; Out of 15 townships, 12 fully meet guidelines. Target achieved. 1.3.1: 12 supported townships use at least five social accountability mechanisms. Target achieved. 2.1.1: 580 women across 15 supported townships benefitted from women empowerment measures within the framework of the project . Target partially achieved. 2.2.1: All 15 supported townships held at least 3 community consultations involving both men and women during the planning process. Target achieved. 2.3.1: 90% of supported CSO reported an improved engagement with Township administrators. Target achieved. 3.1.1: 29.6% of grant allocated to seven TDLG supported townships prioritised for projects in mixed control areas 3.2.1: To be reported in 2020. 4.1.1: 6 products produced in 2020. Target achieved. 4.1.2: One event was held to launch the Gender Equality in Public Administration Report. 2 events were postponed, namely the Local Governance Forum and the Technical Working Group. The Local Governance Donor Coordination Group (LGDCG) was used to disseminate accumulated knowledge. Target partially achieved.

1.1.2: Out of 15 townships at least 12 townships meet level 4 across 4 functions 1.2.1: 95% of full grant amount allocated during planning cycle FY 2019/2020 has been liquidated through implementation of planned projects 1.2.2: At least 90% of selected projects from fiscal year 2020-2021 completed physical progress in line with standards as per Grant Manual and Procurement Guidelines 1.2.3: All 15 supported townships fully comply with set criteria 1.3.1: 15 supported townships use at least five social accountability mechanisms effectively 2.1.1: At least 700 women in all 15 supported townships benefitted from women empowerment measures within the framework of the project 2.3.1: At least 500 W/VTAs in all 15 supported townships hold at least 3 community consultations involving both men and women during the planning process 3.1.1: No control over the target since the decisions are taken in a consultative and participatory manner at each planning cycle and therefore selected projects will be defined after prioritization with all key stakeholders. 3.2.1: 75% of supported townships with EAO areas reach Level 4 4.1.1: At least 16 products 4.1.2: 12

Updated for December 2021 1.1.2 Due to political developments and associated engagement principles, this indicator is no longer relevant. 1.2.1 0% 1.2.2 Assessments ongoing to determine which projects will be completed by UNDP (no engagement with de facto authorities) 1.2.3 & 1.3.1 Due to political developments and associated engagement principles, this indicator is no longer relevant. 2.1.1 Due to political developments and associated engagement principles, this indicator will be reported against in the annual report 2.3.1 & 3.1.1 & 3.2.1 Due to political developments and associated engagement principles, this indicator is no longer relevant. 4.1.1 14 products - Implementation Guidelines - HDI ITT Outcome Report (partially supported by TDLG) - Rakhine HDI Stocktaking Report - Draft EAO Engagement Strategy and EAO Module - 4 periodic briefs for Mon State - 4 monthly briefs by Oxfam - 2 conflict and governance briefs - Weekly Safety Reports from Mon, Bago, Rakhine and Yangon - Policy Brief on Township Planning and Implementation Commitees - Draft Cash for Work Implementation Guidelines - Rural Communities Basic Needs Project, as part of UNDPs CFP - Advisory Note on Northern Mon State Conflict Sensitivity and Security Considerations (Kyaikto, Bilin, Thaton) - Advisory Note on Southern Mon State Conflict Sensitivity and Security Considerations (Mawlamyine, Mudon, Thanbyuzayat and Ye) - Analysis of the education sector in EAO areas
4.1.2 The LG forum has since been cancelled due to the political developments. Where possible, the LGDCG will be used as a forum to discuss the key developments and response measures in local governance areas.
